titleStmt.title: Letter [between 261 and 229 BC]
titleStmt.author: Zenon, son of Agreophon, of Caunus, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 332-333

msContents.summary: Bottom fragment of a letter of Zenon, which preserves a memorandum postscript for Aigyptos, asking him to make certain purchases

msItemStruct.note: 5 lines written along the fibers; the back is blank; the letter was folded six times
Written in the small neat hand of Zenon (or his favorite clerk), cf. P.Col.III 58 and 59 and IV 72 and 75, and p. 40
There is a large check mark on the bottom left part: maybe the letter was returned after completion of the commissions

provenance.p: Purchased by Columbia University from Dr. Kondilios through H.I. Bell in December 1926; no. 50 in Bell's inventory

keywords.term: Aigyptos, -- agent of Apollonios, 1 in Pap.Lugd.Bat. XXI, p. 278

div.ab: Good-bye. Memorandum for Aigyptos --- to bring up from Memphis a basket (paying) up to six drachmas, (namely) a pack basket for a donkey, and from the Thebaid material for garments of 3 1/2 minas weight, (paying) up to 28 drachmas.
